TopicTitle: Kerbal Space Program: Making History Expansion - How to Play and Share with the Mission Builder

Articles.Content:
Hello everyone!

For several months, we have been talking in KSP Weekly about the Mission Builder, which will give players the means of creating their own missions using an intuitive and powerful interface. Last week we detailed how you can use the tools within the Mission Builder to create all sorts of exciting and inventive missions. However, part of the magic of creating something is to be able to share it with others, and as the KSP community has such an intrinsic cooperative nature, it was obvious for us that players needed the tools to share their creations with ease in order for the Mission Builder to be the success we expect.

In this article, we will detail how this key-feature of Making History will work. By following these simple steps, you’ll be ready to export, share and play missions from day one!

Let’s get started. After entering the Start Game screen, you’ll find the expansion’s game modes listed below Scenarios.

Once you’ve clicked on and entered the Mission Builder, you can create a mission using the tools at your disposal.

After you finish creating your mission, click the export button. It’s on the upper right part of the screen.

Clicking it will open the following window, where you will name your mission and enter the mission briefing notes. Here, you can also include mod details, select the custom Play, Success, and Fail Banners, the awards, and other specifications.

After setting all the details, click export. By doing this, a zip file with all the mission game data will be created and exported to the following location: Missions/_Exports [Name].zip

You can copy this zip file and upload it to your favorite client for others to download and play, just as you’d do with a mod!

To play a mission, place the mission’s zip file in KSP/Missions. The game will automatically extract the contents for you, so after that you’ll only have to enter Play Missions in the start screen and select the mission you want to play.

Press start and play! We can’t wait to see all of the missions our community creates in Kerbal Space Program: Making History Expansion!

We expect that a mission sharing community will flourish around Kerbal Space Program: Making History Expansion, so just imagine the amount of fan-made content that will sprout after the release. It will surely be exciting and fun to look for and complete other people’s creations!

Happy launchings!

This sounds like there might be need for a whole new section in the forum to accommodate the new missions .

 

@Deddly has pointed out my lack of eyesight .

Don't you think that Challenges and Mission Ideas covers that already?

4 minutes ago, Deddly said:

Don't you think that Challenges and Mission Ideas covers that already? 

oh yeaahh....forgot it was more than challenges .
Eeeee! Can't wait!

I would like to see version numbers in this UI somewhere, because some players extend and revise things over time. I suppose players could put version numbers as a part of the name.

Steam Workshop integration?  That counts out a lot of players who obtained KSP from other sources, but it would be a nice ez-mode option for Steam users, in a future update.

@Deddly, I would not mind a new forums section for expansion missions, because players will need to specify that their mission requires it, if they use the existing section. Posts could get derailed into "have" and "have not" discussions. Potentially, extra work for moderators   ofc that discussion could break out even in a new section, but it would be easy to point back up at the section heading.   

Edited March 5, 2018 by basic.syntax
removed comment about direct-loading of zip files
Sorry if i mised it but will you be able to set missions and goals in carrer mode whit the mission builder?

4 hours ago, Xilis said:

Sorry if i mised it but will you be able to set missions and goals in carrer mode whit the mission builder?

The Missions and Mission builder are a completely separate mode from Career mode. Missions are basically a Challenge or Scenario mode like you might find in an RTS or management sim and do not interact with Career mode in any way.
Will we be able to link missions, meaning that a player can't start mission 2 until they succeed at mission 1?

Just now, Torgo said:

Will we be able to link missions, meaning that a player can't start mission 2 until they succeed at mission 1?

That would be nice. It would make for a proper campaign.

On 3/1/2018 at 11:04 AM, basic.syntax said:

Could direct loading of ZIP files be incorporated into a future update?  Its probably too late to ask, but, unzipping the package takes a player out of plug-and-play mode. I think its great to promote further tweaking and should remain an option.  If both a zip file and unzipped version of the same mission were found by the loader, the unzipped version (because it could have player changes) would take priority.

umm...

To play a mission, place the mission’s zip file in KSP/Missions. The game will automatically extract the contents for you, so after that you’ll only have to enter Play Missions in the start screen and select the mission you want to play.

I don't know about you, but to me that sounds like exactly what you're asking for.  The game automatically zips the mission for you and unzips it when you load the zip file directly in game.

Maybe this is a silly question which has been asked somewhere else, but will missions be able to be imported into a career game? It would be nice to be able to build/download chains of missions that all work together and can be set to appear in a career once certain prerequisites are met.
